li: Java

Identify the server configuration interface. SSL is usually configured on the web application server. Please, refer to your web application server's documentation or technical support for more information about configuring SSL on your web server.

Examine the server configuration settings. Verify that the web application server is configured to use only FIPS 140-2 compliant algorithms. This means no SSLv1 or SSLv3. In practice, this means using TLSv1 or higher. For more information about compliant algorithms, please see the links at the bottom of this page.
For information about configuring Oracle Web server for FIPS 140-2 compliance, please see http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/E19316-01/820-3320/gjkho/index.html
For information about OpenSSL FIPS 140-2 compliance, please see http://www.sans.edu/research/security-laboratory/article/ssl-tts

For information about configuring Firefox for FIPS 140-2 compliance, please see http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Configuring%20Firefox%20for%20FIPS%20140-2. This article is useful because it lists FIPS 140-2 compliant algorithms.
For more information about FIPS 140-2, please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIPS_140-2

p: Verify that only strong SSL algorithms are used.
Using strong encryption algorithms with SSL helps reduce the risk of successful eavesdropping attacks and assures regulatory compliance.
To verify that only strong SSL algorithms are used:

Identify the server configuration interface. SSL is usually configured on the web application server. Please, refer to your web application server's documentation or technical support for more information about configuring SSL on your web server.

Examine the server configuration settings. Verify that the web application server is configured to use only FIPS 140-2 compliant algorithms. This means no SSLv1 or SSLv3. In practice, this means using TLSv1 or higher. For more information about compliant algorithms, please see the links at the bottom of this page.

To use strong SSL algorithms, configure the web application server to use TLS and not SSL 3.0 or any earlier version of SSL. The exact instructions for doing so are different for different platforms. Please, refer to your web application server's documentation or technical support for detailed instructions on how to configure the server to use TLS.

html:
Applies to

  • Java

What to Check For

Verify that only strong SSL algorithms are used.

Why

Using strong encryption algorithms with SSL helps reduce the risk of successful eavesdropping attacks and assures regulatory compliance.

How to Check

To verify that only strong SSL algorithms are used:

  1. Identify the server configuration interface. SSL is usually configured on the web application server. Please, refer to your web application server's documentation or technical support for more information about configuring SSL on your web server.

  2. Examine the server configuration settings. Verify that the web application server is configured to use only FIPS 140-2 compliant algorithms. This means no SSLv1 or SSLv3. In practice, this means using TLSv1 or higher. For more information about compliant algorithms, please see the links at the bottom of this page.

How to Fix

To use strong SSL algorithms, configure the web application server to use TLS and not SSL 3.0 or any earlier version of SSL. The exact instructions for doing so are different for different platforms. Please, refer to your web application server's documentation or technical support for detailed instructions on how to configure the server to use TLS.

Additional Resources

  • For information about configuring Oracle Web server for FIPS 140-2 compliance, please see http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/E19316-01/820-3320/gjkho/index.html
  • For information about OpenSSL FIPS 140-2 compliance, please see http://www.sans.edu/research/security-laboratory/article/ssl-tts
  • For information about configuring Firefox for FIPS 140-2 compliance, please see http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Configuring%20Firefox%20for%20FIPS%20140-2. This article is useful because it lists FIPS 140-2 compliant algorithms.
  • For more information about FIPS 140-2, please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIPS_140-2
